title: AZ-900 Exam - Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
titleEn: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals AZ-900 Certification Exam
description: A comprehensive 100-question practice exam simulating the AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals certification, covering Cloud Concepts, Azure Architecture & Services, and Azure Management & Governance.

questions.text: What is the primary characteristic of cloud computing?
answers: Delivery of computing services over the internet
questions.correctAnswer: Delivery of computing services over the internet
questions.explanation: Cloud computing is defined as the delivery of computing services—including servers, storage, databases, networking, software—over the internet on a pay-as-you-go basis, eliminating the need for physical infrastructure ownership.

questions.text: In the shared responsibility model, which responsibility always remains with the customer regardless of service type?
answers: Data and information stored in the cloud
questions.correctAnswer: Data and information stored in the cloud
questions.explanation: The customer is always responsible for their data, identities, and devices. Azure manages physical infrastructure, but data governance and information security remain the customer's exclusive responsibility.

questions.text: Which cloud model provides the most flexibility by combining public and private clouds?
questions.explanation: A hybrid cloud combines public and private cloud environments, allowing organizations to leverage benefits of both while maintaining critical data on-premises and scaling with public cloud resources.

questions.text: Which cloud service type places the most responsibility on the cloud provider?
questions.explanation: SaaS places maximum responsibility with the cloud provider, who manages everything except data and user access. The customer simply uses the application without managing infrastructure, OS, or middleware.

questions.text: What is the primary financial benefit of the cloud consumption-based model?
answers: Pay only for resources you actually use
questions.correctAnswer: Pay only for resources you actually use
questions.explanation: The consumption-based model converts IT spending from capital expenditure (CapEx) to operational expenditure (OpEx), allowing organizations to pay only for active resources and scale costs with actual usage.

questions.text: A public cloud is exclusively used by a single organization and is not accessible to the general public.
questions.explanation: By definition, a public cloud is built, controlled, and maintained by a third-party provider and is accessible to anyone who wants to purchase cloud services. A single-tenant cloud is called a private cloud.

questions.text: Which Azure feature allows you to automatically increase VM instances based on demand?
questions.explanation: Virtual Machine Scale Sets enable automatic scaling in or out based on demand, automatically deploying a load balancer and managing identical VM instances for high availability.

questions.text: What is the minimum number of Availability Zones in a region that supports them?
questions.explanation: All Azure regions that support Availability Zones have a minimum of three separate zones to ensure resiliency. Each zone has independent power, cooling, and networking.

questions.text: Vertical scaling refers to adding more virtual machines to handle increased load.
questions.explanation: Vertical scaling (scaling up/down) means increasing/decreasing the capabilities of a resource (e.g., adding CPU/RAM to a VM). Horizontal scaling (scaling out/in) means adding/removing VM instances.

questions.text: Which Azure service helps you extend your on-premises network to Azure over a dedicated private connection?
questions.explanation: ExpressRoute provides a private, dedicated connection that doesn't travel over the public internet, offering more reliability, faster speeds, and higher security than VPN connections.

questions.text: In the shared responsibility model for IaaS, who is responsible for patching the operating system?
answers: No one - OS patching is automatic
questions.explanation: In IaaS, the customer is responsible for OS installation, configuration, maintenance, patching, and updates. Azure only manages the physical infrastructure.

questions.text: A storage account name must be unique across all of Azure.
questions.explanation: Storage account names must be globally unique within Azure (3-24 characters, lowercase letters and numbers) because they form part of the unique namespace URL.

questions.text: Which storage redundancy option provides the highest durability by replicating data across three availability zones in the primary region and to a secondary region?
questions.explanation: Geo-zone-redundant storage (GZRS) combines zone-redundant storage (3 copies across availability zones) with geo-replication to a secondary region, providing 16 nines durability.

questions.text: Azure Files supports both SMB and NFS protocols for file sharing.
questions.explanation: Azure Files offers fully managed file shares accessible via SMB (Windows/Linux/macOS) and NFS (Linux/macOS) protocols, enabling seamless replacement of on-premises file shares.

questions.text: Which of the following is a Platform as a Service (PaaS) offering?
questions.explanation: Azure SQL Database is a fully managed PaaS database service where Azure handles OS, patching, and infrastructure. While Azure Functions is serverless and ACI is container PaaS, SQL Database is the classic PaaS example.

questions.text: Resource locks in Azure can prevent accidental deletion of critical resources.
questions.explanation: Resource locks (CanNotDelete or ReadOnly) prevent resources from being accidentally deleted or modified. They are inherited by child resources and can be applied at subscription, resource group, or resource level.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Azure Policy?
answers: To define and enforce organizational standards for resource compliance
questions.correctAnswer: To define and enforce organizational standards for resource compliance
questions.explanation: Azure Policy enables creation, assignment, and management of policies that enforce rules on resource configurations, ensuring compliance with corporate standards and preventing non-compliant deployments.

questions.text: Azure Blueprints are used to create individual resource templates for one-time deployments.
questions.explanation: Azure Blueprints package policies, RBAC, and ARM templates to create repeatable, compliant environment deployments across multiple subscriptions, not just one-time resource templates.

questions.text: Which tool is best for estimating the total cost of ownership when migrating from on-premises to Azure?
questions.explanation: The TCO Calculator compares on-premises infrastructure costs (including servers, storage, power, labor) against Azure costs over time, helping justify migration decisions.

questions.text: Azure Cost Management budgets can trigger automated actions when spending limits are reached.
questions.explanation: Azure budgets can be configured with alert thresholds that trigger automated actions, such as suspending VMs or alerting administrators, helping control spending.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a centralized view of security posture and threat protection across hybrid and multi-cloud environments?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Defender for Cloud provides unified security management, threat protection, and security posture management for Azure, on-premises, and multi-cloud (AWS, GCP) environments.

questions.text: The Zero Trust security model assumes that all network traffic inside the corporate network is trusted.
questions.explanation: Zero Trust assumes breach by default and requires verification of every request regardless of origin, eliminating the concept of a trusted internal network.

questions.text: Which authentication method provides the highest security and convenience according to Microsoft's authentication matrix?
questions.explanation: Passwordless authentication (Windows Hello, Authenticator app, FIDO2 keys) provides both high security and high convenience, eliminating password vulnerabilities while simplifying user experience.

questions.text: Azure RBAC roles can be assigned at the Management Group level and are inherited by all subscriptions and resources beneath it.
questions.explanation: Azure RBAC is hierarchical. Permissions assigned at a parent scope (Management Group, Subscription, Resource Group) are inherited by all child scopes, simplifying access management.

questions.text: Which Azure service allows you to run Linux and Windows VMs on the same virtual network?
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual Networks support both Linux and Windows VMs, allowing heterogeneous environments to communicate securely within the same isolated network space.

questions.text: Cool access tier in Azure Blob Storage is optimized for data stored for at least 30 days that is infrequently accessed.
questions.explanation: The Cool tier offers lower storage costs for data that remains for at least 30 days with infrequent access, trading slightly lower availability for cost savings.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Azure Arc?
answers: To manage on-premises and multi-cloud resources from Azure
To provide Azure Active Directory services
questions.correctAnswer: To manage on-premises and multi-cloud resources from Azure
questions.explanation: Azure Arc extends Azure management services to hybrid and multi-cloud environments, enabling consistent governance and operations for resources outside Azure.

questions.text: ARM templates use a declarative syntax to define infrastructure.
questions.explanation: ARM templates are JSON files that use declarative syntax to define what resources to deploy and their configuration, without specifying deployment commands.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of cloud computing?
answers: Automatic security patching for all applications
questions.correctAnswer: Automatic security patching for all applications
questions.explanation: While Azure provides automatic patching for some PaaS services, customers remain responsible for patching in IaaS and certain PaaS scenarios. Automatic patching for ALL applications is not a universal cloud benefit.

questions.text: Azure Service Health combines Azure Status, Service Health, and Resource Health to provide a complete view of your environment.
questions.explanation: Azure Service Health integrates global Azure status, service-specific health, and individual resource health to provide comprehensive monitoring from broad infrastructure to specific resources.

questions.text: What is the maximum depth of management groups in a single directory?
questions.explanation: Azure management groups support up to six levels of depth (excluding root and subscription levels) to organize subscriptions hierarchically.

questions.text: Azure Blob Storage can store both structured and unstructured data.
questions.explanation: Azure Blob Storage is specifically designed for unstructured data (text, binary data, media files). Structured data is better suited for Azure SQL Database or Cosmos DB.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides recommendations for cost optimization, security, and performance?
questions.explanation: Azure Advisor continuously analyzes your configuration and usage telemetry to provide personalized recommendations across five categories: Cost, Security, Performance, Reliability, and Operational Excellence.

questions.text: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication requires at least two of the following: something you know, something you have, something you are.
questions.explanation: MFA requires verification from at least two different categories: knowledge (password), possession (phone/token), or inherence (biometrics), significantly strengthening security.

questions.text: Which statement correctly describes geo-redundant storage (GRS)?
answers: Replicates data across three availability zones in one region
Replicates data to a secondary region asynchronously
Provides read access to secondary region data by default
Is the lowest cost redundancy option
questions.correctAnswer: Replicates data to a secondary region asynchronously
questions.explanation: GRS replicates data three times within the primary region using LRS, then asynchronously replicates to a paired secondary region for disaster recovery protection.

questions.text: Resource groups in Azure can be nested within other resource groups.
questions.explanation: Resource groups cannot be nested. Each resource can only belong to one resource group at a time, though resources can be moved between resource groups.

questions.text: What is the primary difference between VPN Gateway and ExpressRoute?
answers: VPN Gateway is faster than ExpressRoute
ExpressRoute uses the public internet while VPN is private
VPN Gateway uses encrypted tunnels over the internet; ExpressRoute is a dedicated private connection
ExpressRoute is only for storage; VPN is for compute
questions.correctAnswer: VPN Gateway uses encrypted tunnels over the internet; ExpressRoute is a dedicated private connection
questions.explanation: VPN Gateway provides secure encrypted connections over the public internet, while ExpressRoute offers a private, dedicated connection with higher reliability and consistent latency.

questions.text: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) is the same as Active Directory on Windows Server.
questions.explanation: Azure AD is a cloud-based identity and access management service, not a direct replica of on-premises Active Directory. While similar, they have different architectures and capabilities.

questions.text: Which Azure service allows you to enforce tagging rules on all newly created resources?
questions.explanation: Azure Policy can enforce tagging conventions by preventing resource creation unless required tags are present, ensuring consistent metadata across your environment.

questions.text: The Archive access tier in Azure Blob Storage has the lowest storage cost but highest access costs.
questions.explanation: Archive tier offers the lowest storage costs for data stored >180 days, but requires hours to rehydrate and incurs high per-transaction fees, making it expensive to access frequently.

questions.text: Which Azure service is best suited for running event-driven code without managing servers?
questions.explanation: Azure Functions is a serverless compute service that runs code on-demand in response to events, automatically scaling and deallocating resources when not in use.

questions.text: ExpressRoute connections go over the public internet.
questions.explanation: ExpressRoute provides private, dedicated connectivity that does NOT traverse the public internet, offering higher security, reliability, and consistent performance.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Azure Service Trust Portal?
answers: To access Microsoft's compliance documentation and audit reports
questions.correctAnswer: To access Microsoft's compliance documentation and audit reports
questions.explanation: The Service Trust Portal provides compliance documentation, audit reports, and security implementation details for Azure, helping organizations meet regulatory requirements.

questions.text: Azure Cost Management can create budgets that trigger automated responses when exceeded.
questions.explanation: Azure Cost Management budgets support automation through action groups, allowing you to trigger workflows like VM shutdowns or notifications when spending thresholds are breached.

questions.text: Which redundancy option is recommended for applications requiring high availability and resilience to zone failures?
questions.explanation: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS) replicates data synchronously across three availability zones, ensuring data remains accessible even if one zone becomes unavailable.

questions.text: Azure Monitor can only monitor resources running in Azure.
questions.explanation: Azure Monitor can collect data from Azure resources, on-premises environments, and even multi-cloud resources, providing unified observability.

questions.text: What is the relationship between Azure subscriptions and Azure Active Directory?
answers: Each subscription requires a separate Azure AD tenant
A subscription is always linked to an Azure AD tenant for identity management
Azure AD is optional for subscriptions
Subscriptions manage Azure AD, not the other way around
questions.correctAnswer: A subscription is always linked to an Azure AD tenant for identity management
questions.explanation: Every Azure subscription is associated with an Azure AD tenant for authentication and authorization. The tenant provides identity services for all subscriptions linked to it.

questions.text: Network Security Groups (NSGs) can be applied to virtual networks and subnets to filter traffic.
questions.explanation: NSGs contain inbound/outbound security rules that can be associated with subnets or individual NICs attached to VMs, providing layered network security.

questions.text: Which Azure service helps you discover and assess on-premises servers for migration to Azure?
questions.explanation: Azure Migrate: Discovery and Assessment scans on-premises VMware, Hyper-V, and physical servers to evaluate readiness, dependencies, and sizing for Azure migration.

questions.text: Read-only resource locks prevent both deletion and modification of resources.
questions.explanation: ReadOnly locks restrict all write and delete operations, allowing only read operations. This protects critical resources from any changes while still permitting visibility.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of Azure tags?
answers: To organize resources with metadata for cost allocation and management
questions.correctAnswer: To organize resources with metadata for cost allocation and management
questions.explanation: Tags are key-value pairs that attach metadata to resources for organization, cost center tracking, environment identification, automation, and governance.

questions.text: The Azure Free Account includes $200 credit for the first 30 days and access to free services for 12 months.
questions.explanation: The Azure free account provides $200 credit for 30 days, 12 months of popular services, and always-free products, enabling exploration without initial costs.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides point-in-time restore capabilities for Blob Storage?
questions.explanation: Blob versioning, soft delete, and change feed together provide comprehensive data protection and point-in-time restore capabilities for blob data.

questions.text: Azure Application Insights requires code changes to monitor web applications.
questions.explanation: Application Insights can monitor applications via an agent without code changes, though installing the SDK provides deeper telemetry and custom event tracking.

questions.text: Which Azure service allows you to manage Windows and Linux machines across on-premises and multiple clouds?
questions.explanation: Azure Arc extends Azure management to servers, Kubernetes clusters, and data services running on-premises, at the edge, or in other clouds like AWS and GCP.

questions.text: Azure Site Recovery is a disaster recovery solution that replicates VMs to a secondary region.
questions.explanation: Azure Site Recovery provides disaster recovery by automatically replicating VMs from a primary region to a secondary region, enabling failover during outages.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of Azure DNS?
answers: To host DNS domains and provide name resolution using Azure infrastructure
To secure DNS queries with encryption
questions.correctAnswer: To host DNS domains and provide name resolution using Azure infrastructure
questions.explanation: Azure DNS is a hosting service for DNS domains that provides reliable, high-performance name resolution using Azure's global network of name servers.

questions.text: AzCopy is a graphical user interface tool for copying data to Azure Storage.
questions.explanation: AzCopy is a command-line utility, not a GUI tool. Azure Storage Explorer is the graphical tool for managing storage, while AzCopy is used for scripted data transfers.

questions.text: Which Azure service enables you to create, deploy, and manage resources using declarative JSON templates?
questions.explanation: Azure Resource Manager is the deployment and management service that processes ARM templates (JSON files) to create, update, and delete resources in a consistent, orchestrated manner.

questions.text: Azure Availability Sets use update domains and fault domains to protect against planned and unplanned maintenance.
questions.explanation: Availability Sets group VMs across update domains (sequential maintenance) and fault domains (common power/network), ensuring at least one VM remains available during outages.

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of the pay-as-you-go pricing model?
answers: You pay a flat monthly fee regardless of usage
You only pay for resources you consume
You must commit to a one-year term minimum
questions.correctAnswer: You only pay for resources you consume
questions.explanation: Pay-as-you-go is an OpEx model where costs directly correlate with actual resource consumption, enabling elasticity and eliminating upfront capital expenditures.

questions.text: Azure Policy can automatically remediate non-compliant resources without any user intervention.
questions.explanation: Azure Policy can auto-remediate some resources, but many policies require manual intervention or have a 'manual' effect. Auto-remediation is not universal and depends on resource type.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a managed Kubernetes container orchestration platform?
questions.explanation: AKS is a managed Kubernetes service that simplifies deploying and managing containerized applications at scale, while ACI is for individual containers without orchestration.

questions.text: Reserved capacity in Azure provides discounts of up to 72% compared to pay-as-you-go pricing.
questions.explanation: Committing to 1-3 year reserved capacity for VMs, SQL Database, and other services can provide discounts of up to 72% over pay-as-you-go rates for predictable workloads.

questions.text: Which authentication method uses biometric data like fingerprints or facial recognition?
questions.explanation: Biometric authentication falls under 'something you are' — inherence factors like fingerprints, facial recognition, or iris scans that are unique physical characteristics.

questions.text: Network traffic between peered virtual networks travels over the public internet.
questions.explanation: VNet peering uses the Microsoft backbone network, never entering the public internet, ensuring private, low-latency connectivity between virtual networks.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Azure Security Benchmark?
answers: To provide a checklist for physical security
To define Azure-specific security and compliance best practices
questions.correctAnswer: To define Azure-specific security and compliance best practices
questions.explanation: Azure Security Benchmark is a Microsoft-authored set of guidelines providing Azure-specific security and compliance best practices that Defender for Cloud uses to assess resources.

questions.text: Azure Data Box is used for offline data transfer when network bandwidth is limited.
questions.explanation: Azure Data Box is a physical device shipped to customers for secure offline transfer of large datasets (>40TB) when network connectivity is insufficient or expensive.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides desktop virtualization running in the cloud?
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual Desktop (formerly Windows Virtual Desktop) is a desktop and app virtualization service running on Azure, enabling remote work from any device.

questions.text: Azure Load Balancer operates at Layer 4 (transport layer) of the OSI model.
questions.explanation: Azure Load Balancer is a Layer 4 (TCP/UDP) load balancer that distributes traffic based on source/destination IP and port, without inspecting application content.

questions.text: What is Recovery Point Objective (RPO) in disaster recovery?
answers: The maximum acceptable time to restore service
The amount of data that can be lost during recovery
questions.correctAnswer: The amount of data that can be lost during recovery
questions.explanation: RPO represents the maximum acceptable amount of data loss measured in time (e.g., 15 minutes), determining how frequently backups or replication must occur.

questions.text: Azure Private Link provides private connectivity to Azure PaaS services over the Microsoft backbone network.
questions.explanation: Azure Private Link enables private access to Azure services (like Storage, SQL) via private endpoints in your VNet, keeping traffic off the public internet.

questions.text: Which tool would you use to enforce that all storage accounts are created with encryption enabled?
questions.explanation: Azure Policy can enforce organizational standards by denying the creation of storage accounts that don't have encryption enabled, ensuring compliance at deployment time.

questions.text: Azure Container Instances require you to manage the underlying virtual machines.
questions.explanation: ACI is a serverless container platform that abstracts VM management. You simply upload containers and Azure runs them without requiring VM provisioning or orchestration.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Azure Bastion?
answers: To provide RDP/SSH access to VMs without public IPs
questions.correctAnswer: To provide RDP/SSH access to VMs without public IPs
questions.explanation: Azure Bastion is a PaaS service that provides secure, seamless RDP/SSH connectivity to VMs directly in the Azure portal without requiring public IPs or VPN.

questions.text: Azure Lighthouse allows service providers to manage multiple customer Azure tenants from a single control plane.
questions.explanation: Azure Lighthouse enables cross-tenant management, allowing service providers to deliver managed services to multiple customers with delegated resource management.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a managed database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MariaDB?
questions.explanation: Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MariaDB are fully managed, community edition database services with built-in high availability and scalability.

questions.text: Azure Traffic Manager uses DNS-based traffic routing to direct clients to the closest Azure region.
questions.explanation: Traffic Manager is a DNS-based load balancer that routes clients to the most appropriate Azure endpoint based on health and routing method (e.g., geographic, performance).

questions.text: What is the difference between Azure CLI and Azure PowerShell?
answers: Azure CLI is Windows only; PowerShell is cross-platform
Azure CLI uses Bash commands; PowerShell uses PowerShell cmdlets
PowerShell is deprecated in favor of CLI
questions.correctAnswer: Azure CLI uses Bash commands; PowerShell uses PowerShell cmdlets
questions.explanation: Both are cross-platform, but Azure CLI uses Bash-style commands (az vm create), while Azure PowerShell uses PowerShell cmdlets (New-AzVM). Functionality is equivalent.

questions.text: Azure DDoS Protection Standard provides mitigation for Layer 3, 4, and 7 attacks.
questions.explanation: Azure DDoS Protection Standard defends against volumetric (L3/4) and application-layer (L7) attacks, providing always-on monitoring and automatic attack mitigation.

questions.text: Which Azure service enables you to create workflows that integrate apps, data, and services?
questions.explanation: Azure Logic Apps is a cloud platform for creating and running automated workflows that integrate apps, data, services, and systems with hundreds of connectors.

questions.text: Azure Front Door is a global, scalable entry-point for web applications that uses edge locations.
questions.explanation: Azure Front Door is a modern cloud CDN with intelligent threat protection that uses Microsoft's global edge network to accelerate, secure, and scale web applications.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Azure Key Vault?
answers: To store and manage cryptographic keys, certificates, and secrets
To encrypt all Azure services automatically
questions.correctAnswer: To store and manage cryptographic keys, certificates, and secrets
questions.explanation: Azure Key Vault is a managed service for securely storing and accessing secrets, encryption keys, and SSL/TLS certificates with FIPS 140-2 Level 3 protection.

questions.text: Azure Spot VMs allow you to purchase unused capacity at significant discounts with no eviction risk.
questions.explanation: Spot VMs offer up to 90% discounts but can be evicted with short notice when Azure needs capacity. They are suitable for fault-tolerant, interruptible workloads only.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a fully managed event routing service?
questions.explanation: Azure Event Grid is a fully managed event routing service that enables event-driven architectures with reliable delivery and massive scale, connecting publishers to subscribers.

questions.text: Azure Disk Encryption uses BitLocker for Windows VMs and dm-crypt for Linux VMs.
questions.explanation: Azure Disk Encryption integrates with OS-native encryption (BitLocker for Windows, dm-crypt for Linux) to encrypt OS and data disks at rest using Azure Key Vault-managed keys.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Azure Virtual WAN?
answers: To connect branch offices to Azure via VPN/ExpressRoute
questions.correctAnswer: To connect branch offices to Azure via VPN/ExpressRoute
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual WAN is a networking service that provides optimized, automated branch connectivity to Azure through site-to-site VPN, ExpressRoute, and point-to-site VPN.

questions.text: Azure Private Endpoint provides a private IP address from your VNet to access Azure PaaS services.
questions.explanation: Private Endpoints assign a private IP from your VNet address space to Azure services, enabling secure access without exposing public endpoints or using public IPs.

questions.text: Which Azure service would you use to create a machine learning model without writing code?
questions.explanation: Azure Machine Learning includes Automated ML and a visual designer for building, training, and deploying ML models without writing code, though it also supports code-based development.

questions.text: Azure Monitor Alerts can send notifications via email, SMS, push notifications, and webhooks.
questions.explanation: Azure Monitor Alerts integrate with Action Groups that support multiple notification channels including email, SMS, Azure app push notifications, voice calls, and webhooks.

questions.text: Which Azure service helps you implement infrastructure as code for repeatable deployments?
questions.explanation: ARM Templates provide declarative IaC, while Azure CLI and PowerShell are imperative tools that can be scripted. All three enable repeatable, automated infrastructure deployment.

questions.text: Azure Cosmos DB is a globally distributed, multi-model database service.
questions.explanation: Cosmos DB is Microsoft's globally distributed, horizontally partitioned, multi-model database service with SLA-backed low latency and multiple consistency models.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a managed Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka platform?
questions.explanation: Azure HDInsight is a managed, full-spectrum, open-source analytics service for enterprises that provides Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, and other big data frameworks.

questions.text: Azure Policy initiatives group related policies together for easier management.
questions.explanation: Initiatives are collections of related policies that can be assigned as a single unit, such as the 'Enable Monitoring in Azure Security Center' initiative with 100+ policies.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides real-time analytics on streaming data?
questions.explanation: Azure Stream Analytics is a real-time analytics service that processes streaming data from IoT devices, applications, and other sources with SQL-like queries.

questions.text: Azure Backup provides backup for on-premises servers, Azure VMs, and SQL databases.
questions.explanation: Azure Backup is a unified solution that protects on-premises files, folders, system state, Hyper-V/VMware VMs, Azure VMs, and SQL/SAP HANA databases.

questions.text: Which Azure service would you use to migrate a large on-premises database to Azure SQL Database with minimal downtime?
questions.explanation: Azure Database Migration Service enables seamless, minimal-downtime migrations from on-premises SQL Server to Azure SQL Database with continuous replication.

questions.text: Azure Firewall is a managed, cloud-based network security service that protects your Azure Virtual Network resources.
questions.explanation: Azure Firewall is a managed, stateful L3-L7 firewall service with built-in high availability and unrestricted cloud scalability for VNet protection.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides identity protection and risk-based conditional access policies?
questions.explanation: Azure AD Identity Protection uses machine learning to detect suspicious sign-ins and risky users, enabling automated risk-based conditional access policies.

questions.text: The Azure Well-Architected Framework includes five pillars: Cost Optimization, Operational Excellence, Performance Efficiency, Reliability, and Security.
questions.explanation: The Azure Well-Architected Framework provides guiding principles across these five pillars to help design and operate secure, reliable, efficient, and cost-effective solutions in Azure.
